translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Section with Timira
“In the past, on the Himalayas,🔽I lived in a mountain cave.
I was clothed in antelope hide,

analyzed: vasāmi pabbatantare  suvaṇṇa vaṇṇam sambuddha  satarasiva
translated: and I lived in the mountains.🔽I saw the One Perfected, golden-hued,
shining like the sun,🔽in the forest,
like a blossoming royal sāla tree.
I was delighted and my mind was calmed,
I raised my joined palms in reverence,
and I bowed my head to the ground.
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the result of the perception of delight.
I have done what the Buddha asked.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā raṁsisaññako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā rasisaññakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the elder Raṁsisaññaka recited these verses.
